Method Detail

enqueue

public void enqueue(E object)
             throws IllegalStateException
Appends the specified element to the end of this queue. The end of the queue is given by its strategy.

Specified by:
enqueue in interface Queue<E>
Overrides:
enqueue in class DecoratorQueue<E>
Parameters:
object - element to be appended at the end of this queue.
Throws:
IllegalStateException - if the queue is already closed when this method is called.

getObjectSize

public int getObjectSize()
Returns the estimated size of the objects which are stored in the memory of this memory manageable object. This method can be called from the strategy of the memory manager to obtain useful information for distributing main memory among the memory using objects.

Specified by:
getObjectSize in interface MemoryManageable
Returns:
Returns the size of the objects in this SweepArea (in bytes).

getPreferredMemSize

public int getPreferredMemSize()
Returns the amount of memory which is needed by this object for an acceptable performance. This method can be called from the strategy of the memory manager to obtain useful information for distributing main memory among the memory using objects.

Specified by:
getPreferredMemSize in interface MemoryManageable
Returns:
Returns the preferred amount of memory (in bytes).

getAssignedMemSize

public int getAssignedMemSize()
Returns the amount of memory, which is actually assigned to this object by the memory manager.

Specified by:
getAssignedMemSize in interface MemoryManageable
Returns:
Returns the assigned amount of memory (in bytes).

assignMemSize

public void assignMemSize(int newMemSize)
Assigns a special amount of memory to this object.

Specified by:
assignMemSize in interface MemoryManageable
Parameters:
newMemSize - The amount of memory to be assigned to this object (in bytes).

getCurrentMemUsage

public int getCurrentMemUsage()
Returns the amount of memory, which is actually used by this object. This method can be called from the strategy of the memory manager to obtain useful information for distributing main memory among the memory using objects.

Specified by:
getCurrentMemUsage in interface MemoryMonitorable
Returns:
Returns the amount of memory actually used by this object (in bytes).

handleOverflow

public abstract void handleOverflow()
This method is called, if an overflow has occured. Implementors of subclasses have to specify how to handle the overflow.
